00026   class CaliceEcalCalibrationKit : public CalibrationKit
00027   {
00028   protected:
00029     CaliceEcalCalibrationKit() {
00030       CalibrationFactory *instance=CalibrationFactory::getInstance();
00031       instance->registerCalibrationKit("CaliceEcalCalibration",this);
00032     };
00033 
00034     static CaliceEcalCalibrationKit __instance;
00035   public:
00036     Calibration *create(const std::string &module_type_col_name,  const std::string &module_calibration_col_name) const {
00037       std::cout << "CalibrationKit::create> Create CaliceEcalCalibration." << std::endl;
00038       return new CaliceEcalCalibration(module_type_col_name, module_calibration_col_name);
00039     };
00040   };

00051   // dummy object used to initialise arrays.
00052   EcalModuleCalibration CaliceEcalCalibration::_empty("",0,0);
00053 
00054   CaliceEcalCalibration::CaliceEcalCalibration(const std::string &module_type_col_name, const std::string &calibration_constants_col_name) 
00055     throw(std::runtime_error)
00056     : _moduleTypeChange(this, &CaliceEcalCalibration::moduleTypeChanged),
00057       _calibrationConstantChange(this, &CaliceEcalCalibration::calibrationConstantChanged)
00058   {
00059     if (module_type_col_name.empty()) {
00060       throw std::runtime_error("CaliceEcalCalibration::ctor> The name for the collection of module types (i.e. module descriptions) must not be empty.");
00061     }
00062     if (calibration_constants_col_name.empty()) {
00063       throw std::runtime_error("CaliceEcalCalibration::ctor> The name for the calibration constant collection must not be empty.");
00064     }
00065 
00066     if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener( &_moduleTypeChange ,module_type_col_name)) {
00067       std::stringstream message;
00068       message << "CaliceEcalCalibration::CaliceEcalCalibration> no conditions data handler for collection " << module_type_col_name << ".";
00069       throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00070     }
00071     if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener( &_calibrationConstantChange , calibration_constants_col_name)) {
00072       std::stringstream message;
00073       message << "CaliceEcalCalibration::CaliceEcalCalibration> no conditions data handler for collection " << calibration_constants_col_name << ".";
00074       throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00075     }
00076   }

00078 
00079   void CaliceEcalCalibration::moduleTypeChanged(lcio::LCCollection* col) {
00080 
00081     _calibrationConstantsPerType.clear();
00082 
00083     std::pair<ModuleTypeCalibrationConstantList_t *,std::string> dummy_element
00084       =make_pair((ModuleTypeCalibrationConstantList_t *) 0,std::string(""));
00085 
00086     for (UInt_t type_i=0; type_i< static_cast<UInt_t>(col->getNumberOfElements()); type_i++) {
00087       ModuleDescription a_module(col->getElementAt(type_i));
00088       if (a_module.getModuleType()>_calibrationConstantsPerType.size()) {
00089         _calibrationConstantsPerType.resize(a_module.getModuleType()+1,dummy_element );
00090       }
00091       if (a_module.getModuleType()==_calibrationConstantsPerType.size()) {
00092         _calibrationConstantsPerType.push_back(make_pair(dummy_element.first,a_module.getModuleTypeName()));
00093       }
00094       else {
00095         _calibrationConstantsPerType[a_module.getModuleType()]=make_pair(dummy_element.first,a_module.getModuleTypeName());
00096       }
00097     }
00098 
00099     if (!_calibrationConstants.empty()) {
00100       // now correctly set the pointers to the arrays with the calibration constants
00101       for(CalibrationConstantPerTypeList_t::iterator per_type_iter=_calibrationConstantsPerType.begin();
00102           per_type_iter!=_calibrationConstantsPerType.end();
00103           per_type_iter++) {
00104         
00105         // search module type 
00106         std::map<std::string, ModuleTypeCalibrationConstantList_t >::const_iterator type_iter=_calibrationConstants.find(per_type_iter->second);
00107         
00108         // Module types may be defined which are actually not used.
00109         // Thus, it is a valid case that no calibration constants are assigned to a certain module type
00110         if (type_iter!=_calibrationConstants.end()) {
00111           //      std::stringstream message;
00112           //      message << "CaliceEcalCalibration::calibrationConstantChanged> Do not find calibration constants for type " << per_type_iter->second 
00113           //              << ".";
00114           //      throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00115           per_type_iter->first=&(type_iter->second);
00116         }
00117       }
00118     }
00119   }
00120 
00121   void CaliceEcalCalibration::calibrationConstantChanged(lcio::LCCollection* col) 
00122   {
00123     _calibrationConstants.clear();
00124     
00125     // first put the calibration constants of all modules in arrays for each module type 
00126     // the module types are "C", "G", "D"
00127     // seperately and using the module type ID as an array index.
00128     Float_t maxCalibrationConstant=-FLT_MAX;
00129     for (UInt_t type_i=0; type_i< static_cast<UInt_t>(col->getNumberOfElements()); type_i++) {
00130       EcalModuleCalibration a_module(col->getElementAt(type_i));
00131 
00132       // Issue a warning if the serial number is large.
00133       // The serial number is used as an array index (for simplicity).
00134       // This an array from the zero to the largest serial number is
00135       // generated. This will lead to very large arrays if the serial
00136       // numbers are not small (1-~50) as expected.
00137       if (a_module.getModuleID()>10*static_cast<UInt_t>(col->getNumberOfElements())) {
00138         std::cerr << "CaliceEcalCalibration::moduleTypeChanged> Very large serial number. This may blow up the memory consumption since the serial number is used as an array index.";
00139       }
00140 
00141       for (UInt_t cell_i=0; cell_i<a_module.getNCells(); cell_i++) {
00142         Float_t calib_const=a_module.getCalibrationConstant(cell_i);
00143         if (calib_const>maxCalibrationConstant) {
00144           maxCalibrationConstant=calib_const;
00145         }
00146       }
00147       
00148       // the method is slow so we cache the result.
00149       std::string module_type_name=a_module.getModuleTypeName();
00150       
00151       // search module type 
00152       std::map<std::string, ModuleTypeCalibrationConstantList_t >::iterator type_iter=_calibrationConstants.find(module_type_name);
00153 
00154       if (type_iter==_calibrationConstants.end()) {
00155         std::pair< std::map<std::string, ModuleTypeCalibrationConstantList_t>::iterator , Bool_t > result;
00156         result=_calibrationConstants.insert(make_pair(module_type_name,ModuleTypeCalibrationConstantList_t()));
00157 
00158         // I belief that the following check is not necessary
00159         if (!result.second) throw std::runtime_error("CaliceEcalCalibration::calibrationConstantChanged> Failed to add Calibration constants to list.");
00160         type_iter=result.first;
00161       }
00162 
00163       if (a_module.getModuleID()>type_iter->second.size()) {
00164         type_iter->second.resize(a_module.getModuleID(),EcalModuleCalibration(_empty.obj()));
00165       }
00166       if (a_module.getModuleID()==type_iter->second.size()) {
00167         type_iter->second.push_back(a_module);
00168       }
00169       else {
00170         type_iter->second[a_module.getModuleID()]=a_module;
00171       }
00172     }
00173 
00174     if (maxCalibrationConstant<=0) {
00175       throw std::runtime_error("CaliceEcalCalibration::calibrationConstantChanged> The maximum calibration constant is not a positive value.");
00176     }
00177     _minInvCalibrationConstant=1/maxCalibrationConstant;
00178 
00179     // now rebuild the array which contains for each module type a pointer to the array with the calibration constants for 
00180     // each the modules identified by their module ID. 
00181     for(CalibrationConstantPerTypeList_t::iterator per_type_iter=_calibrationConstantsPerType.begin();
00182         per_type_iter!=_calibrationConstantsPerType.end();
00183         per_type_iter++) {
00184 
00185       // search module type 
00186       std::map<std::string, ModuleTypeCalibrationConstantList_t >::const_iterator type_iter=_calibrationConstants.find(per_type_iter->second);
00187 //       if (type_iter==_calibrationConstants.end()) {
00188 //      std::stringstream message;
00189 //      message << "CaliceEcalCalibration::calibrationConstantChanged> Do not find calibration constants for type " << per_type_iter->second 
00190 //              << ".";
00191 //      throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00192 //       }
00193       per_type_iter->first=&(type_iter->second);
00194     }
00195 
00196 
00197   }
